alert.note: Alert for Central and Southern Lewis and Clark (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Chill Warning issued February 21 at 10:50AM MST until February 23 at 3:00PM MST by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...WIND CHILL WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 PM MST WEDNESDAY... ...WINTER STORM WARNING WILL EXPIRE AT 11 AM MST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Dangerously cold wind chills. Wind chills as low as 45 below zero. * WHERE...Central and Southern Lewis and Clark County. * WHEN...Until 3 PM MST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Wind chill values in the Helena and Lincoln Valleys are generally expected to range from 25 to 35 degrees below zero, with the coldest wind chill values occurring over MacDonald and Rogers Pass.
info.instruction: Avoid outside activities if possible. When outside, make sure you wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. To see a graphical representation of the degree of stress on young livestock please visit our webpage and select Local Programs then Cold Air Advisory for Newborn Livestock.

area.areaDesc: Central and Southern Lewis and Clark
